alert.note: Alert for Anson; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 3:58AM EST until further notice by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Rocky River Near Norwood affecting Stanly and Anson Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rocky River near Norwood. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Action Stage. The river begins to overflow its banks in some areas upstream of the gage site. At 20.0 feet, Minor flood stage. There is significant overflow into adjacent pasture and lowlands. At 27.0 feet, The parking lot at the Anson County boat access on the will begin to flood At 30.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins. There is widespread flooding of pasture and lowlands adjacent to the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 31.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:45 AM EST Wednesday was 31.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 5.5 feet early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 31.6 feet on 02/07/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Sun Rocky River Norwood 20.0 31.6 Wed 3 am EST 11.1 7.0 6.0 5.6 &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 400 PM EST.
